column1: This spreadsheet is based on Kedaliya's edition of the Śabdamaṇidarpaṇa of Kēśirāja. See https://github.com/aso2101/kannadaroots.

column4: to be or become deficient in growth.
to strike with the nails or claws.
to loosen from out of the hand, etc.
to touch strongly or forcibly to push, etc.
to seize or grasp hastily, etc.
to search for with the hands, etc.
to put in another place, etc.
to speak in an indistinct tone, etc.
to leap, as a wild beast.
to work on the floor for treading out corn.
to deposit, etc., to beat, to kill.
to lick the itch as beasts do.
to eat in a certain manner.
to beat a cloth to a small extent.
to wound with the nails or claws.
to be in trembling oscillation from haughtiness.
to enter, as a thread into a needle, to be threaded, to thread.
to contract, as a flower, etc.
to tremble or fear, to be glad, to chew.
to let loose from the fingers, to discharge or propel with the fingers.
to get or have a corrupt, musty smell.
to search about or for with the hands.
to support, to come into close contact.
to sound inarticulately, to mutter, to bum,
to let go from the hand, etc.
to be deprived of juice, to shrivel, etc.
to work in a corn-field, etc.
to be covered or enveloped, etc.
to be born, to wash clothes.
to fume in the smoke of incense and other materials, to smoke,
to exert one’s self secretly, etc.
to come into close contact, etc.
to do (a certain kind of) weaving-business.
to cause to expand or open.
to cause to fall down (from above).
to make go or come near or to.
to unharness or unyoke as a coach.
to put into close contact, to join.
to cause to be stretched, etc.
to cause to go away from a place.
to cause to enter a small opening, etc.
to make great noise by slapping or clapping the arms (one ms. kōpōdrēkē to enrage).
to impede or trouble the eye.
to cause to hang down, etc.
to deprive of motion, activity, etc.
to cause to fall down, etc.
to cause to siṅk in a piece of water.
to walk in a disfigured manner, to halt.
to make a certain performance with the fingers.
to dig with the nails or claws.
to dig with the nails or claws.
to make a gift of raiment at a wedding.
gāḍhapravēśē to cause to enter firmly.
to point at with the finger.
a ring or halo to form.
to reach a thing placed on high.
to make one, to put together.
to tie (or set in) the hair,
to cut; śakalē că a piece, a potsherd.
to enter in, or make enter, by mouthfuls.
to fix the arrow (to the bow),
to be sewed, stitched, united; to sew, etc.
to let go or send off from the hand, etc.
to put firmly or close together.
to touch, as sin or wind, etc.
to be cold; bhayē to fear.
to move to and fro in water, etc.
to let go from the hand, to throw away.
to dig with the fingers, etc.,
to roll about, to welter, etc.
to show excessive regard, to praise.
to be without hesitation, be fearless.
to squeeze out with the fist (o.r.. niṣpīḍanē)
to cut off with the nails.
to speak so as to reveal a secret, etc.
to strike or throw with the finger.
the mind to be fettered, etc.
to twang a bow. string (o.r. jēvoḍe).
to come in contact with (o.r. aṇi).
to strike or propel with the finger.
to strike with the fingers, etc.
to unite miscellaneous things, twist, etc..
to cover so as to obstruct, hem in.
to be in contact; kalaha-saṅkhyayõḥ a fight; the number 10.
to move off, go away, etc.
to make wet; to be wet.
to work with the pestle, to pound; ghāta-mardanayōḥ to kill, to grind.
to siṅk under water, dive (o.r. āḻdu).
to crush a little or slightly, to squash.
the grass Saccharum munja (not in all Mss.).
to bend (v.i.); vakrabhūmau crooked or bent ground.
to do the work of a potter; ākāśagōmayapiṇḍapuñjayõḥ the sky; a heap of cakes of cow-dung.
to bring forth, as cattle and other beasts.
to succeed in one's adopted cause.
to cause to burn or flame.
to be zealously active in going (cf. 91).
to scatter about with the hand.
to cause to descend, to lower.
to inform against a thief; to be detected as a thief.
to become full of effort, etc.; to rise or swell.
to work with a pestle, to pound.
to discharge by means of the fingers,
to make or twist a rope.
to eat as beasts do, to graze.
to perform manual or mechanical art.

column4: to pick up single things, select.
to do or to put inside, etc.
to shave; tantu granthi varāhayõḥ a knot in thread; a hog.
to be burnt, to cinder, be charred.
to slide or slip down, as a baṅk.
to be closely united, be liṅked to.
to do away with filth of excretion of the skin.
the face to be turned or averted.
to search for a time or occasion, look for.
to catch with a net, fish.
to cut leather lengthwise or in straps; drava-dravyanirmuktau to set free a liquid, pour out.
to cry aloud; halānvita-vr̥sabha-yugmē a pair of oxen yoked to a plough,
the taste of something upripe to exist.
to be of an intolerable nature or very disagreeable.
to be of an intolerable nature or very disagreeable.
to scratch the throat, to be astringent to the taste.
to sound as a black bee and other insects
to shout with energy or for joy.
to be in a swinging motion.
to slight, disgrace, to shake, be unsteady.
to hang down motionless or powerless; to faint.
to be thin; takra-mañjīrayōḥ butter milk mixed with water; a foot-ring, aṅklet.
to work with the pestle, to pound,
to whirl round; to wander about.
to let loose from the hand.
the face to be turned or averted; to turn backwards.
to be in scornful wrath, in wrath which knows no smile.
to spread out or run as a creeper.
to enter a place, to enter.
to be sticky, gummy; to suffer distress.
to be sticky, gummy; to suffer distress.
to test by eating, to taste.
to remove by wiping or rubbing.
to draw the whole towards one’s self.
to seek with the hands, grope.
burning to go beyond the proper limit.
to begin fighting by flourishing the hands; to give a sign with the hand.
to begin, to exert one's self.
to go round; a coat of mail.
to wave lamps before a person or idol.
a heap to be formed of miscellaneous things.
to rinse the mouth with water.
to bend one's self from couquetry.
to be agitated or alarmed, as a herd of cattle.
to become bewildered or be beguiled.
to be agitated in one's mind.
to cause to read, as the śāstras.
to cause to encompass as a fort.
the young of an animal to be born (?).
to give a loud sound, to bawl.
to rage; to rub off or away.
to make noise by slapping or clapping the arms.
to pull to its full extent.
to be grieved, to grow enraged.
to give away according to one’s inclination.
to end, to die, to go or be removed very far.
to squeeze out; dalanarthē kuḷam but when meaning ‘to burst’ it is hiḷi, for instance hiḷḷane hiḷidudu.
to draw with power, to pull.
to engage in, to be known or famous.
to lay hold of and forcibly to drag.
to dive into water, to sit in water; sēvakē kuḷam but when meaning ‘serve’ it is written as āḷ.
to dive into water, to sit in water; sēvakē kuḷam but when meaning ‘serve’ it is written as āḷ.
to live; khaḍgē kuḷam but when meaning ‘sword’ written as bāḷ.
to obtain; atapatrabhēdē ṟaḻam when meaning ‘parasol’ it is written as taḻe.

column3: prakṣālanē to remove by washing, wash.

column4: to roll about; nadyarthē ṟaḻam but when meaning ‘river’ written as poḻe.
to throw away; kaḷāyām kṣalam but when meaning‘lustre,’ the ḷ is kṣaḷa.
(o.r. vigatabhāva) to be deprived of power.
to be or become clean or clear; jñānaprasannabhāvayōḥ to be known, to know; to be pleased.
to bear; vr̥kṣē ṟaḻam but when meaning ‘the palmyra tree’ it is written as tāḻ.
to offer into fire; nivr̥ddhau to be without growth.
lustre to go away or disappear, grow dim.
to enter a door or opening.
to enter a door or opening.
to sound as a dog, to bark.
to contact, shrivel, uruḷ nimnapatanē to roll down.
to take away life, to kill.
to put together in regular order.
